intro: Draba brachystemon, commonly known as the narrow-stemmed rockcress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its simple, basal leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Draba brachystemon is often found in high-altitude habitats and is part of the diverse flora of the Himalayas and surrounding regions.
